alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 2:41PM MDT until August 03 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 241 PM MDT, Capitol Reef National Park Rangers reported ongoing flash flooding within Grand Wash. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Additional thunderstorm activity has now shifted over southern portions of the warned area...specifically over Sheet`s Gulch. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, and slot canyons. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
